intro: Gongrothamnus hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Sierra redshank, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. It has a compact, shrub-like structure with dense, dark green leaves. Gongrothamnus hildebrandtii is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in open, sunny areas.
